oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EFFECT OF WAVE DISSIPATORS ON OVERTOPPING OVER A BERMED SEAWALL IN DEEPWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yu, Melissa Meng-Jiuan
Lee, Jui-Heng
Lee, Min-Chi
Lee, Chung-Pan
Hsu, John Rong-Chung
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bermed seawall
wave overtopping
laboratory experiments
NN-Overtopping
building setback
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wave overtopping is an important factor for designing harbor breakwater and shore-protection structure, and the safety of facilities, working areas and people in their lee. This paper reports the results of a series of laboratory experiments on the effect of six types of wave energy dissipation mechanisms on wave overtopping over a bermed seawall that protects a reclaim land for a specialized yacht industry zone in Taiwan. Numerical method using NN- Overtopping is also applied to determine suitable building setback distance for storm in different recurrent periods.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; structures.8
